job_title: Analyst/Associate, Business Support – Sales & Trading / Treasury (Bilingual Japanese-English)
full_description:
\n
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?
\n
\n
Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), one of the world’s leading financial groups. Across the globe, we’re 150,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.
\n
\n
With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.
\n
\n
Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.
\n
The selected colleague will work at an MUFG office or client sites four days per week and work remotely one day. A member of our recruitment team will provide more details.\n
\n
Summary:
Join a leading financial services firm as an entry-level
Business Support Analyst
in our front office
Sales & Trading and Treasury team
. This role provides
operational support
,
onboarding coordination
, and
KPI reporting
for front office Sales & Trading, Treasury staffs including expats from our Head Office (Japan). Ideal for candidates seeking exposure to dynamic
global markets
and complex
financial operations
, and
global &
cross-functional collaboration
.
\n
Responsibilities:
\n
\n
Support
Sales, Trading, and Treasury staffs
onboarding by collaborating IT and facilities (desk set up, Bloomberg terminal, market data access, shared drive permissions, etc.).
\n
Maintain business unit specific
HR information
,
delegation of authority forms
, and cross-entity assignments and liaise with legal and compliance team
\n
Produce predefined desk
KPI reports
periodically
\n
Track and process staff expenses and vendor invoices by working with Finance and Account Payable
\n
Help to
arrange & facilitate
mid-large sized meetings in person / remote
\n
Coordinate with
IT, HR, Compliance
,
Finance
and other internal teams for ad hoc inquiry from
Sales & Trading and Treasury team
and Head office
\n
Provide
bilingual Japanese-English communication support
, including document translation and meeting assistance.
\n
\n
Qualifications:
\n
\n
Bachelor’s degree in
finance, Business, Economics
, or related field
\n
Fluency in Japanese and English
(verbal and written)
\n
Strong communication skills to facilitate troubleshooting and meticulous follow-up with stakeholders
\n
Strong desktop work skills and proficiency in
Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint
,
Teams
and
Copilot
\n
Mutli-tasking, self-disciplined step by step task management / execution skills
\n
\n
Preferred Qualifications
\n
\n
Familiarity with financial markets, trading systems, or treasury operations.
\n
Prior internship or experience in financial services (Global Bank / Sales & Trading / Broker-Dealer) is a plus (but not mandatory)
\n
\n
\n
The typical base pay range for this role is between $69K - $100K depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and location. This role may also be eligible for certain discretionary performance-based bonus and/or incentive compensation. Additionally, our Total Rewards program provides colleagues with a competitive benefits package (in accordance with the eligibility requirements and respective terms of each) that includes comprehensive health and wellness benefits, retirement plans, educational assistance and training programs, income replacement for qualified employees with disabilities, paid maternity and parental bonding leave, and paid vacation, sick days, and holidays. For more information on our Total Rewards package, please click the link below.
\n
MUFG Benefits Summary
\n
We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws (including (i) the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, (ii) the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, (iii) the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, and (iv) the California Fair Chance Act) to the extent that (a) an applicant is not subject to a statutory disqualification pursuant to Section 3(a)(39) of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934 or Section 8a(2) or 8a(3) of the Commodity Exchange Act, and (b) they do not conflict with the background screening requirements of the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) and the National Futures Association (NFA). The major responsibilities listed above are the material job duties of this role for which the Company reasonably believes that criminal history may have a direct, adverse and negative relationship potentially resulting in the withdrawal of conditional offer of employment, if any.\n
